intro: Galarhoeus lasiocaulus f. miyagiensis, commonly known as the Miyagi's hairy stalked bellflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Japan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
